alert.note: Alert for Burnett; Douglas; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 5:25PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN DOUGLAS, NORTHWESTERN WASHBURN AND NORTHEASTERN BURNETT COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM CDT... At 525 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dairyland, or 30 miles northwest of Spooner, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Douglas, northwestern Washburn and northeastern Burnett Counties, including the following locations... Cozy Corner, Minong Flowage and Moose Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. This storm may intensify. Monitor local NOAA Weather Radio, commercial radio, or television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
